intro: Mascagnia haenkeana, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers that are tubular in shape, often with a contrasting red or orange throat. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, typically in well-drained soils. Mascagnia haenkeana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
